definition: a noisy fight or disturbance : row, commotion
examples: heard a ruckus down the street
He went outside to see what all the ruckus was about.
The dogs … typically would set off quite a ruckus whenever they heard something in the woods …

definition: a state or situation in which many people are angry or upset : fuss, uproar
examples: … IHOP recently caused a social media ruckus after announcing it would change its name …
… the county's GOP is embroiled in a lively legal ruckus over an attempt to seize control of the party.
